Class Camera

public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Camera class
Author:
Hilla and Oria

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Camera​(primitives.Point3D P0, primitives.Vector VTo, primitives.Vector VUp)
    The Camera basic constructor, uses the newer constructor
    Camera​(primitives.Point3D P0, primitives.Vector VTo, primitives.Vector VUp, double ApertureSize, double FocalDistance, boolean DepthOfField)
    The Camera constructor, sets a value for all fields- p0, vUp, vTo, vRight, width, height, distance, apertureSize, focalDistance, depthOfField (not using the field numberOfRays)
    Camera​(primitives.Point3D P0, primitives.Vector VTo, primitives.Vector VUp, double ApertureSize, double FocalDistance, boolean DepthOfField, int NumberOfRays)
    The Camera constructor, sets a value for all fields- p0, vUp, vTo, vRight, width, height, distance, apertureSize, focalDistance, depthOfField, numberOfRays

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera​(primitives.Point3D P0, primitives.Vector VTo, primitives.Vector VUp)
      The Camera basic constructor, uses the newer constructor
      Parameters:
      P0 - for the middle point of the camera
      VTo - for the vTo vector that goes forward from the camera
      VUp - for the vUp vector that goes up from the camera
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vUp and vTo aren't orthogonal

    • Camera

      public Camera​(primitives.Point3D P0, primitives.Vector VTo, primitives.Vector VUp, double ApertureSize, double FocalDistance, boolean DepthOfField)
      The Camera constructor, sets a value for all fields- p0, vUp, vTo, vRight, width, height, distance, apertureSize, focalDistance, depthOfField (not using the field numberOfRays)
      Parameters:
      P0 - for the middle point of the camera
      VTo - for the vTo vector that goes forward from the camera
      VUp - for the vUp vector that goes up from the camera
      ApertureSize - for the size of the double aperture
      FocalDistance - for the size of the focal distance of the focal plane
      DepthOfField - for knowing if we're using the depthOfField algorithm or not
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vUp and vTo aren't orthogonal

    • Camera

      public Camera​(primitives.Point3D P0, primitives.Vector VTo, primitives.Vector VUp, double ApertureSize, double FocalDistance, boolean DepthOfField, int NumberOfRays)
      The Camera constructor, sets a value for all fields- p0, vUp, vTo, vRight, width, height, distance, apertureSize, focalDistance, depthOfField, numberOfRays
      Parameters:
      P0 - for the middle point of the camera
      VTo - for the vTo vector that goes forward from the camera
      VUp - for the vUp vector that goes up from the camera
      ApertureSize - for the size of the double aperture
      FocalDistance - for the size of the focal distance of the focal plane
      DepthOfField - for knowing if we're using the depthOfField algorithm or not
      NumberOfRays - of the amount of rays
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vUp and vTo aren't orthogonal

    • calcFocalPoint

      public primitives.Point3D calcFocalPoint​(primitives.Ray ray)
      Calculates the focal point of the sent ray with the focal plane of the camera
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray we're calculating the focal point for
      Returns:
      Point3D the focal point of the sent ray and the focal plane of the camera

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public primitives.Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Constructs *ONE* ray from the camera through a given pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in one row in the view plane (width)
      nY - number of pixels in one column in the view plane (height)
      j - the y coordinate of the pixel
      i - the x coordinate of the pixel
      Returns:
      ray that goes from the camera and through the pixel

    • constructManyRaysThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<primitives.Ray> constructManyRaysThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Constructs *MANY* rays from the camera through a given pixel, uses the constructManyRaysUsingDOF function
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in one row in the view plane (width)
      nY - number of pixels in one column in the view plane (height)
      j - the y coordinate of the pixel
      i - the x coordinate of the pixel
      Returns:
      List a list of all the rays that go from the camera and through the pixel with the DOF algorithm

    • constructManyRaysUsingDOF

      public java.util.List<primitives.Ray> constructManyRaysUsingDOF​(primitives.Ray FirstRay, double Distance)
      Constructs *MANY* rays through a pixel by using the DOF algorithm
      Parameters:
      FirstRay -
      Distance -
      Returns:
      List a list of all the rays that were constructed

    • constructManyRaysUsingSuperSampling

      public java.util.List<primitives.Ray> constructManyRaysUsingSuperSampling​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Constructs *MANY* rays through a pixel by using the super-sampling algorithm
      Parameters:
      nX - the amount of pixels in width
      nY - the amount of pixels in height
      j - the specific placement on width
      i - the specific placement on height
      Returns:
      List the list of all constructed rays

    • calcPoint

      public primitives.Point3D calcPoint​(primitives.Point3D PC, double Yi, double Xj, double placementX, double placementY)
      Calculates the new point to construct the rays using ASS from
      Parameters:
      PC - the starting center point
      Yi - the specific placement of the current point (y)
      Xj - the specific placement of the current point (x)
      placementX - the new offset (x)
      placementY - the new offset (y)
      Returns:
      Point3D the new calculated point for the recursion

    • constructManyRaysUsingASS

      public java.util.List<primitives.Ray> constructManyRaysUsingASS​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double topCornerX, double topCornerY, double bottomCornerX, double bottomCornerY)
      Constructs *MANY* rays using the adaptive super-sampling algorithm
      Parameters:
      nX - the amount of pixels in width
      nY - the amount of pixels in height
      j - the specific placement on width
      i - the specific placement on height
      topCornerX - the max value of x
      topCornerY - the max value of y
      bottomCornerX - the min value of x
      bottomCornerY - the min value of y
      Returns:
      List the list of all constructed rays
